02608       if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Statistics/Events per sec.", &hKeyEq) ==
02609           DB_SUCCESS)
02610          db_create_link(hDB, 0, "/History/Links/System/Trigger per sec.",
02611                         "/Equipment/Trigger/Statistics/Events per sec.");
02612 
02613       if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Statistics/kBytes per sec.", &hKeyEq) ==
02614           DB_SUCCESS)
02615          db_create_link(hDB, 0, "/History/Links/System/Trigger kB per sec.",
02616                         "/Equipment/Trigger/Statistics/kBytes per sec.");
02617    }
02618 
02619    /*---- define equipment events as history ------------------------*/
02620 
02621    max_event_id = 0;
02622 
02623    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Equipment", &hKeyRoot);
02624    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
02625       cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "Cannot find Equipment entry in database");
02626       return 0;
02627    }
02628 
02629    /* loop over equipment */
02630    for (index = 0; index < MAX_HISTORY; index++) {
02631       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, index, &hKeyEq);
02632       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02633          break;
02634 
02635       /* check history flag */
02636       size = sizeof(history);
02637       db_get_value(hDB, hKeyEq, "Common/Log history", &history, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
02638 
02639       /* define history tags only if log history flag is on */
02640       if (history > 0) {
02641          /* get equipment name */
02642          db_get_key(hDB, hKeyEq, &key);
02643          strcpy(eq_name, key.name);
02644 
02645 
02646          status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyEq, "Variables", &hKeyVar);
02647          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
02648             cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history",
02649                    "Cannot find /Equipment/%s/Variables entry in database", eq_name);
02650             return 0;
02651          }
02652 
02653          size = sizeof(event_id);
02654          db_get_value(hDB, hKeyEq, "Common/Event ID", &event_id, &size, TID_WORD, TRUE);
02655 
02656          if (verbose)
02657             printf
02658                 ("\n==================== Equipment \"%s\", ID %d  =======================\n",
02659                  eq_name, event_id);
02660 
02661          /* count keys in variables tree */
02662          for (n_var = 0, n_tags = 0;; n_var++) {
02663             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyVar, n_var, &hKey);
02664             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02665                break;
02666             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
02667             n_tags += key.num_values;
02668          }
02669 
02670          if (n_var == 0)
02671             cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "defined event %d with no variables in ODB",
02672                    event_id);
02673 
02674          /* create tag array */
02675          tag = (TAG *) malloc(sizeof(TAG) * n_tags);
02676 
02677          for (i = 0, i_tag = 0;; i++) {
02678             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyVar, i, &hKey);
02679             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02680                break;
02681 
02682             /* get variable key */
02683             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &varkey);
02684 
02685             /* look for names */
02686             db_find_key(hDB, hKeyEq, "Settings/Names", &hKeyNames);
02687             single_names = (hKeyNames > 0);
02688             if (hKeyNames) {
02689                if (verbose)
02690                   printf("Using \"/Equipment/%s/Settings/Names\" for variable \"%s\"\n",
02691                          eq_name, varkey.name);
02692 
02693                /* define tags from names list */
02694                db_get_key(hDB, hKeyNames, &key);
02695                n_names = key.num_values;
02696             } else {
02697                sprintf(str, "Settings/Names %s", varkey.name);
02698                db_find_key(hDB, hKeyEq, str, &hKeyNames);
02699                if (hKeyNames) {
02700                   if (verbose)
02701                      printf
02702                          ("Using \"/Equipment/%s/Settings/Names %s\" for variable \"%s\"\n",
02703                           eq_name, varkey.name, varkey.name);
02704 
02705                   /* define tags from names list */
02706                   db_get_key(hDB, hKeyNames, &key);
02707                   n_names = key.num_values;
02708                }
02709             }
02710 
02711             if (hKeyNames && varkey.num_values != n_names) {
02712                cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history",
02713                       "Mismatch between \"/Equipment/%s/Settings/%s\" and \"/Equipment/%s/Variables/%s\" (%d vs. %d entries)", eq_name,
02714                       key.name, eq_name, varkey.name, n_names, varkey.num_values);
02715                free(tag);
02716                     return 0;
02717                  }
02718 
02719             if (hKeyNames) {
02720                /* loop over array elements */
02721                for (j = 0; j < varkey.num_values; j++) {
02722                   /* get name #j */
02723                   size = NAME_LENGTH;
02724                   db_get_data_index(hDB, hKeyNames, tag[i_tag].name, &size, j,
02725                                     TID_STRING);
02726 
02727                   /* append variable key name for single name array */
02728                   if (single_names) {
02729                      if (strlen(tag[i_tag].name) + 1 + strlen(varkey.name) >= NAME_LENGTH) {
02730                         cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history",
02731                                "Name for history entry \"%s %s\" too long",
02732                                tag[i_tag].name, varkey.name);
02733                         free(tag);
02734                         return 0;
02735                      }
02736                      strcat(tag[i_tag].name, " ");
02737                      strcat(tag[i_tag].name, varkey.name);
02738                   }
02739 
02740                   tag[i_tag].type = varkey.type;
02741                   tag[i_tag].n_data = 1;
02742 
02743                   if (verbose)
02744                      printf("Defined tag \"%s\", size 1\n", tag[i_tag].name);
02745 
02746                   i_tag++;
02747                }
02748             } else {
02749                strcpy(tag[i_tag].name, varkey.name);
02750                tag[i_tag].type = varkey.type;
02751                tag[i_tag].n_data = varkey.num_values;
02752 
02753                if (verbose)
02754                   printf("Defined tag \"%s\", size %d\n", tag[i_tag].name,
02755                          varkey.num_values);
02756 
02757                i_tag++;
02758             }
02759          }
02760 
02761          hs_define_event(event_id, eq_name, tag, sizeof(TAG) * i_tag);
02762          free(tag);
02763 
02764          if (verbose)
02765             printf("\n");
02766 
02767          /* setup hist_log structure for this event */
02768          hist_log[index].event_id = event_id;
02769          hist_log[index].hKeyVar = hKeyVar;
02770          db_get_record_size(hDB, hKeyVar, 0, &size);
02771          hist_log[index].buffer_size = size;
02772          hist_log[index].buffer = malloc(size);
02773          hist_log[index].period = history;
02774          hist_log[index].last_log = 0;
02775          if (hist_log[index].buffer == NULL) {
02776             cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "cannot allocate history buffer");
02777             return 0;
02778          }
02779 
02780          /* open hot link to variables */
02781          status = db_open_record(hDB, hKeyVar, hist_log[index].buffer,
02782                                  size, MODE_READ, log_history, NULL);
02783          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02784             cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history",
02785                    "cannot open variable record for history logging");
02786 
02787          /* remember maximum event id for later use with system events */
02788          if (event_id > max_event_id)
02789             max_event_id = event_id;
02790       } else {
02791          hist_log[index].event_id = 0;
02792          hist_log[index].hKeyVar = 0;
02793          hist_log[index].buffer = NULL;
02794          hist_log[index].buffer_size = 0;
02795          hist_log[index].period = 0;
02796       }
02797    }
02798 
02799    if (index == MAX_HISTORY) {
02800       cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "too many equipments for history");
02801       return 0;
02802    }
02803 
02804    /*---- define linked trees ---------------------------------------*/
02805 
02806    /* round up event id */
02807    max_event_id = ((int) ((max_event_id + 1) / 10) + 1) * 10;
02808 
02809    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/History/Links", &hKeyRoot);
02810    if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
02811       for (li = 0;; li++) {
02812          status = db_enum_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, li, &hHistKey);
02813          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02814             break;
02815 
02816          db_get_key(hDB, hHistKey, &histkey);
02817          strcpy(hist_name, histkey.name);
02818          db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, li, &hHistKey);
02819 
02820          db_get_key(hDB, hHistKey, &key);
02821          if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
02822             cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "Only subkeys allows in /history/links");
02823             continue;
02824          }
02825 
02826          if (verbose)
02827             printf
02828                 ("\n==================== History link \"%s\", ID %d  =======================\n",
02829                  hist_name, max_event_id);
02830 
02831          /* count subkeys in link */
02832          for (i = n_var = 0;; i++) {
02833             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hHistKey, i, &hKey);
02834             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02835                break;
02836 
02837             if (status == DB_SUCCESS && db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key) == DB_SUCCESS) {
02838                if (key.type != TID_KEY)
02839                   n_var++;
02840             } else {
02841                db_enum_link(hDB, hHistKey, i, &hKey);
02842                db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
02843                cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history",
02844                       "History link /History/Links/%s/%s is invalid", hist_name,
02845                       key.name);
02846                return 0;
02847             }
02848          }
02849 
02850          if (n_var == 0)
02851             cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "History event %s has no variables in ODB",
02852                    hist_name);
02853          else {
02854             /* create tag array */
02855             tag = (TAG *) malloc(sizeof(TAG) * n_var);
02856 
02857             for (i = 0, size = 0, n_var = 0;; i++) {
02858                status = db_enum_link(hDB, hHistKey, i, &hLinkKey);
02859                if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02860                   break;
02861 
02862                /* get link key */
02863                db_get_key(hDB, hLinkKey, &linkkey);
02864 
02865                if (linkkey.type == TID_KEY)
02866                   continue;
02867 
02868                /* get link target */
02869                db_enum_key(hDB, hHistKey, i, &hVarKey);
02870                if (db_get_key(hDB, hVarKey, &varkey) == DB_SUCCESS) {
02871                   /* hot-link individual values */
02872                   if (histkey.type == TID_KEY)
02873                      db_open_record(hDB, hVarKey, NULL, varkey.total_size, MODE_READ,
02874                                     log_system_history, (void *) index);
02875 
02876                   strcpy(tag[n_var].name, linkkey.name);
02877                   tag[n_var].type = varkey.type;
02878                   tag[n_var].n_data = varkey.num_values;
02879 
02880                   if (verbose)
02881                      printf("Defined tag \"%s\", size %d\n", tag[n_var].name,
02882                             varkey.num_values);
02883 
02884                   size += varkey.total_size;
02885                   n_var++;
02886                }
02887             }
02888 
02889             /* hot-link whole subtree */
02890             if (histkey.type == TID_LINK)
02891                db_open_record(hDB, hHistKey, NULL, size, MODE_READ, log_system_history,
02892                               (void *) index);
02893 
02894             hs_define_event(max_event_id, hist_name, tag, sizeof(TAG) * n_var);
02895             free(tag);
02896 
02897             if (verbose)
02898                printf("\n");
02899 
02900             /* define system history */
02901 
02902             hist_log[index].event_id = max_event_id;
02903             hist_log[index].hKeyVar = hHistKey;
02904             hist_log[index].buffer_size = size;
02905             hist_log[index].buffer = malloc(size);
02906             hist_log[index].period = 10;        /* 10 sec default period */
02907             hist_log[index].last_log = 0;
02908             if (hist_log[index].buffer == NULL) {
02909                cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "cannot allocate history buffer");
02910                return 0;
02911             }
02912 
02913             index++;
02914             max_event_id++;
02915 
02916             if (index == MAX_HISTORY) {
02917                cm_msg(MERROR, "open_history", "too many equipments for history");
02918                return 0;
02919             }
02920          }
02921       }
02922    }
02923 
02924    /*---- define run start/stop event -------------------------------*/
02925 
02926    tag = (TAG *) malloc(sizeof(TAG) * 2);
02927 
02928    strcpy(tag[0].name, "State");
02929    tag[0].type = TID_DWORD;
02930    tag[0].n_data = 1;
02931 
02932    strcpy(tag[1].name, "Run number");
02933    tag[1].type = TID_DWORD;
02934    tag[1].n_data = 1;
02935 
02936    hs_define_event(0, "Run transitions", tag, sizeof(TAG) * 2);
02937    free(tag);
02938 
02939    return CM_SUCCESS;
02940 }
02941 
02942 /*---- close_history -----------------------------------------------*/
02943 
02944 void close_history()
02945 {
02946    INT i, status;
02947    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKey;
02948 
02949    /* close system history */
02950    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/History/Links", &hKeyRoot);
02951    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
02952       for (i = 0;; i++) {
02953          status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, i, &hKey);
02954          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02955             break;
02956          db_close_record(hDB, hKey);
02957       }
02958    }
02959 
02960    /* close event history */
02961    for (i = 1; i < MAX_HISTORY; i++)
02962       if (hist_log[i].hKeyVar) {
02963          db_close_record(hDB, hist_log[i].hKeyVar);
02964          free(hist_log[i].buffer);
02965       }
02966 }
02967 
02968 /*---- log_history -------------------------------------------------*/
02969 
02970 void log_history(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *info)
02971 {
02972    INT i, size;
02973 
02974    for (i = 0; i < MAX_HISTORY; i++)
02975       if (hist_log[i].hKeyVar == hKey)
02976          break;
02977 
02978    if (i == MAX_HISTORY)
02979       return;
02980 
02981    /* check if over period */
02982    if (ss_time() - hist_log[i].last_log < hist_log[i].period)
02983       return;
02984 
02985    /* check if event size has changed */
02986    db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &size);
02987    if (size != hist_log[i].buffer_size) {
02988       close_history();
02989       open_history();
02990    }
02991 
02992    hs_write_event(hist_log[i].event_id, hist_log[i].buffer, hist_log[i].buffer_size);
02993    hist_log[i].last_log = ss_time();
02994 }
02995 
02996 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02997 
02998 void log_system_history(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *info)
02999 {
03000    INT i, size, total_size, status, index;
03001    KEY key;
03002 
03003    index = (int) ((PTYPE) info);
03004 
03005    /* check if over period */
03006    if (ss_time() - hist_log[index].last_log < hist_log[index].period)
03007       return;
03008 
03009    for (i = 0, total_size = 0;; i++) {
03010       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hist_log[index].hKeyVar, i, &hKey);
03011       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03012          break;
03013 
03014       db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
03015       size = key.total_size;
03016       db_get_data(hDB, hKey, (char *) hist_log[index].buffer + total_size, &size,
03017                   key.type);
03018       total_size += size;
03019    }
03020 
03021    if (total_size != hist_log[index].buffer_size) {
03022       close_history();
03023       open_history();
03024    } else
03025       hs_write_event(hist_log[index].event_id, hist_log[index].buffer,
03026                      hist_log[index].buffer_size);
03027 
03028    hist_log[index].last_log = ss_time();
03029 
03030    /* simulate odb key update for hot links connected to system history */
03031    if (!rpc_is_remote()) {
03032       db_lock_database(hDB);
03033       db_notify_clients(hDB, hist_log[index].hKeyVar, FALSE);
03034       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03035    }
03036 
03037 }
03038 
03039 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03040 
03041 INT log_callback(INT index, void *prpc_param[])
03042 {
03043    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKeyChannel;
03044    INT i, status, size, channel, izero, htape, online_mode;
03045    DWORD watchdog_timeout;
03046    BOOL watchdog_flag;
03047    char str[256];
03048    double dzero;
03049 
03050    /* rewind tapes */
03051    if (index == RPC_LOG_REWIND) {
03052       channel = *((INT *) prpc_param[0]);
03053 
03054       /* loop over all channels */
03055       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Channels", &hKeyRoot);
03056       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03057          cm_msg(MERROR, "log_callback", "cannot find Logger/Channels entry in database");
03058          return 0;
03059       }
03060 
03061       /* check online mode */
03062       online_mode = 0;
03063       size = sizeof(online_mode);
03064       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/online mode", &online_mode, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03065 
03066       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CHANNELS; i++) {
03067          status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, i, &hKeyChannel);
03068          if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03069             break;
03070 
03071          /* skip if wrong channel, -1 means rewind all channels */
03072          if (channel != i && channel != -1)
03073             continue;
03074 
03075          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
03076             size = sizeof(str);
03077             status =
03078                 db_get_value(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Settings/Type", str, &size, TID_STRING,
03079                              TRUE);
03080             if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03081                continue;
03082 
03083             if (equal_ustring(str, "Tape")) {
03084                size = sizeof(str);
03085                status =
03086                    db_get_value(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Settings/Filename", str, &size,
03087                                 TID_STRING, TRUE);
03088                if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03089                   continue;
03090 
03091                if (ss_tape_open(str, O_RDONLY, &htape) == SS_SUCCESS) {
03092                   cm_msg(MTALK, "log_callback", "rewinding tape #%d, please wait", i);
03093 
03094                   cm_get_watchdog_params(&watchdog_flag, &watchdog_timeout);
03095                   cm_set_watchdog_params(watchdog_flag, 300000);        /* 5 min for tape rewind */
03096                   ss_tape_rewind(htape);
03097                   if (online_mode)
03098                      ss_tape_unmount(htape);
03099                   cm_set_watchdog_params(watchdog_flag, watchdog_timeout);
03100 
03101                   cm_msg(MINFO, "log_callback", "Tape %s rewound sucessfully", str);
03102                } else
03103                   cm_msg(MERROR, "log_callback", "Cannot rewind tape %s", str);
03104 
03105                ss_tape_close(htape);
03106 
03107                /* clear statistics */
03108                dzero = izero = 0;
03109                log_chn[i].statistics.bytes_written_total = 0;
03110                log_chn[i].statistics.files_written = 0;
03111                db_set_value(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Statistics/Bytes written total", &dzero,
03112                             sizeof(dzero), 1, TID_DOUBLE);
03113                db_set_value(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Statistics/Files written", &izero,
03114                             sizeof(izero), 1, TID_INT);
03115             }
03116          }
03117       }
03118 
03119       cm_msg(MTALK, "log_callback", "tape rewind finished");
03120    }
03121 
03122    return RPC_SUCCESS;
03123 }
03124 
03125 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03126 
03127 /********************************************************************\
03128 
03129                          transition callbacks
03130 
03131 \********************************************************************/
03132 
03133 struct {
03134    DWORD transition;
03135    DWORD run_number;
03136 } eb;
03137 
03138 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03139 
03140 INT tr_start(INT run_number, char *error)
03141 /********************************************************************\
03142 
03143   Prestart:
03144 
03145     Loop through channels defined in /logger/channels.
03146     Neglect channels with are not active.
03147     If "filename" contains a "%", substitute it by the
03148     current run number. Open logging channel and
03149     corresponding buffer. Place a event request
03150     into the buffer.
03151 
03152 \********************************************************************/
03153 {
03154    INT size, index, status;
03155    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKeyChannel;
03156    char str[256], path[256], dir[256], data_dir[256];
03157    CHN_SETTINGS *chn_settings;
03158    KEY key;
03159    BOOL write_data, tape_flag = FALSE;
03160    time_t now;
03161    struct tm *tms;
03162 
03163    /* save current ODB */
03164    odb_save("last.odb");
03165 
03166    /* read global logging flag */
03167    size = sizeof(BOOL);
03168    write_data = TRUE;
03169    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Write data", &write_data, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
03170 
03171    /* read tape message flag */
03172    size = sizeof(tape_message);
03173    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Tape message", &tape_message, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
03174 
03175    /* loop over all channels */
03176    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Channels", &hKeyRoot);
03177    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03178       /* if no channels are defined, define at least one */
03179       status = db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Channels/0/", strcomb(chn_settings_str));
03180       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03181          strcpy(error, "Cannot create channel entry in database");
03182          cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03183          return 0;
03184       }
03185 
03186       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Channels", &hKeyRoot);
03187       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03188          strcpy(error, "Cannot create channel entry in database");
03189          cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03190          return 0;
03191       }
03192    }
03193 
03194    for (index = 0; index < MAX_CHANNELS; index++) {
03195       status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, index, &hKeyChannel);
03196       if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
03197          break;
03198 
03199       /* correct channel record */
03200       db_get_key(hDB, hKeyChannel, &key);
03201       status = db_check_record(hDB, hKeyRoot, key.name, strcomb(chn_settings_str), TRUE);
03202       if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_OPEN_RECORD) {
03203          cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", "Cannot create/check channel record");
03204          break;
03205       }
03206 
03207       if (status == DB_SUCCESS || status == DB_OPEN_RECORD) {
03208          /* if file already open, we had an abort on the previous start. So
03209             close and delete file in order to create a new one */
03210          if (log_chn[index].handle) {
03211             log_close(&log_chn[index], run_number);
03212             if (log_chn[index].type == LOG_TYPE_DISK) {
03213                cm_msg(MINFO, "tr_prestart", "Deleting previous file \"%s\"",
03214                       log_chn[index].path);
03215                unlink(log_chn[index].path);
03216             }
03217          }
03218 
03219          /* if FTP channel alreay open, don't re-open it again */
03220          if (log_chn[index].ftp_con)
03221             continue;
03222 
03223          /* save settings key */
03224          status =
03225              db_find_key(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Settings", &log_chn[index].settings_hkey);
03226          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03227             strcpy(error, "Cannot find channel settings info");
03228             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03229             return 0;
03230          }
03231 
03232          /* save statistics key */
03233          status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Statistics", &log_chn[index].stats_hkey);
03234          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03235             strcpy(error, "Cannot find channel statistics info");
03236             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03237             return 0;
03238          }
03239 
03240          /* clear statistics */
03241          size = sizeof(CHN_STATISTICS);
03242          db_get_record(hDB, log_chn[index].stats_hkey, &log_chn[index].statistics, &size,
03243                        0);
03244 
03245          log_chn[index].statistics.events_written = 0;
03246          log_chn[index].statistics.bytes_written = 0;
03247 
03248          db_set_record(hDB, log_chn[index].stats_hkey, &log_chn[index].statistics, size,
03249                        0);
03250 
03251          /* get channel info structure */
03252          chn_settings = &log_chn[index].settings;
03253          size = sizeof(CHN_SETTINGS);
03254          status =
03255              db_get_record(hDB, log_chn[index].settings_hkey, chn_settings, &size, 0);
03256          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
03257             strcpy(error, "Cannot read channel info");
03258             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03259             return 0;
03260          }
03261 
03262          /* don't start run if tape is full */
03263          if (log_chn[index].type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE &&
03264              chn_settings->tape_capacity > 0 &&
03265              log_chn[index].statistics.bytes_written_total >= chn_settings->tape_capacity)
03266          {
03267             strcpy(error, "Tape capacity reached. Please load new tape");
03268             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03269             return 0;
03270          }
03271 
03272          /* check if active */
03273          if (!chn_settings->active || !write_data)
03274             continue;
03275 
03276          /* check for type */
03277          if (equal_ustring(chn_settings->type, "Tape"))
03278             log_chn[index].type = LOG_TYPE_TAPE;
03279          else if (equal_ustring(chn_settings->type, "FTP"))
03280             log_chn[index].type = LOG_TYPE_FTP;
03281          else if (equal_ustring(chn_settings->type, "Disk"))
03282             log_chn[index].type = LOG_TYPE_DISK;
03283          else {
03284             sprintf(error,
03285                     "Invalid channel type \"%s\", pease use \"Tape\", \"FTP\" or \"Disk\"",
03286                     chn_settings->type);
03287             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03288             return 0;
03289          }
03290 
03291          data_dir[0] = 0;
03292 
03293          /* if disk, precede filename with directory if not already there */
03294          if (log_chn[index].type == LOG_TYPE_DISK &&
03295              chn_settings->filename[0] != DIR_SEPARATOR) {
03296             size = sizeof(data_dir);
03297             dir[0] = 0;
03298             db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data Dir", data_dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03299             if (data_dir[0] != 0)
03300                if (data_dir[strlen(data_dir) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
03301                   strcat(data_dir, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
03302             strcpy(str, data_dir);
03303 
03304             /* append subdirectory if requested */
03305             if (chn_settings->subdir_format[0]) {
03306                tzset();
03307                time(&now);
03308                tms = localtime(&now);
03309 
03310                strftime(dir, sizeof(dir), chn_settings->subdir_format, tms);
03311                strcat(str, dir);
03312                strcat(str, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
03313             }
03314 
03315             /* create directory if needed */
03316 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03317             status = mkdir(str);
03318 #else
03319             status = mkdir(str, 0755);
03320 #endif
03321 #if !defined(HAVE_MYSQL) && !defined(OS_WINNT) /* errno not working with mySQL lib */
03322             if (status == -1 && errno != EEXIST)
03323                cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", "Cannot create subdirectory %s", str);
03324 #endif
03325 
03326             strcat(str, chn_settings->filename);
03327          } else
03328             strcpy(str, chn_settings->filename);
03329 
03330          /* substitue "%d" by current run number */
03331          if (strchr(str, '%'))
03332             sprintf(path, str, run_number);
03333          else
03334             strcpy(path, str);
03335 
03336          strcpy(log_chn[index].path, path);
03337 
03338          /* write back current file name to ODB */
03339          if (strncmp(path, data_dir, strlen(data_dir)) == 0)
03340             strcpy(str, path + strlen(data_dir));
03341          else
03342             strcpy(str, path);
03343          db_set_value(hDB, hKeyChannel, "Settings/Current filename", str, 256, 1,
03344                       TID_STRING);
03345 
03346          if (log_chn[index].type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE &&
03347              log_chn[index].statistics.bytes_written_total == 0 && tape_message) {
03348             tape_flag = TRUE;
03349             cm_msg(MTALK, "tr_prestart", "mounting tape #%d, please wait", index);
03350          }
03351 
03352          /* open logging channel */
03353          status = log_open(&log_chn[index], run_number);
03354 
03355          /* return if logging channel couldn't be opened */
03356          if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
03357             if (status == SS_FILE_ERROR)
03358                sprintf(error, "Cannot open file %s (Disk full?)", path);
03359             if (status == SS_FILE_EXISTS)
03360                sprintf(error, "File %s exists already, run start aborted", path);
03361             if (status == SS_NO_TAPE)
03362                sprintf(error, "No tape in device %s", path);
03363             if (status == SS_TAPE_ERROR)
03364                sprintf(error, "Tape error, cannot start run");
03365             if (status == SS_DEV_BUSY)
03366                sprintf(error, "Device %s used by someone else", path);
03367             if (status == FTP_NET_ERROR || status == FTP_RESPONSE_ERROR)
03368                sprintf(error, "Cannot open FTP channel to [%s]", path);
03369             if (status == SS_NO_ROOT)
03370                sprintf(error,
03371                        "No ROOT support compiled into mlogger, please compile with -DHAVE_ROOT flag");
03372 
03373             if (status == SS_INVALID_FORMAT)
03374                sprintf(error,
03375                        "Invalid data format, please use \"MIDAS\", \"YBOS\", \"ASCII\", \"DUMP\" or \"ROOT\"");
03376 
03377             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03378             return 0;
03379          }
03380 
03381          /* close records if open from previous run start with abort */
03382          if (log_chn[index].stats_hkey)
03383             db_close_record(hDB, log_chn[index].stats_hkey);
03384          if (log_chn[index].settings_hkey)
03385             db_close_record(hDB, log_chn[index].settings_hkey);
03386 
03387          /* open hot link to statistics tree */
03388          status =
03389              db_open_record(hDB, log_chn[index].stats_hkey, &log_chn[index].statistics,
03390                             sizeof(CHN_STATISTICS), MODE_WRITE, NULL, NULL);
03391          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03392             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart",
03393                    "cannot open statistics record, probably other logger is using it");
03394 
03395          /* open hot link to settings tree */
03396          status =
03397              db_open_record(hDB, log_chn[index].settings_hkey, &log_chn[index].settings,
03398                             sizeof(CHN_SETTINGS), MODE_READ, NULL, NULL);
03399          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03400             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart",
03401                    "cannot open channel settings record, probably other logger is using it");
03402 
03403 #ifndef FAL_MAIN
03404          /* open buffer */
03405          status =
03406              bm_open_buffer(chn_settings->buffer, EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE,
03407                             &log_chn[index].buffer_handle);
03408          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
03409             sprintf(error, "Cannot open buffer %s", str);
03410             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03411             return 0;
03412          }
03413          bm_set_cache_size(log_chn[index].buffer_handle, 100000, 0);
03414 
03415          /* place event request */
03416          status = bm_request_event(log_chn[index].buffer_handle,
03417                                    (short) chn_settings->event_id,
03418                                    (short) chn_settings->trigger_mask,
03419                                    GET_ALL, &log_chn[index].request_id, receive_event);
03420 
03421          if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
03422             sprintf(error, "Cannot place event request");
03423             cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03424             return 0;
03425          }
03426 
03427          /* open message buffer if requested */
03428          if (chn_settings->log_messages) {
03429             status =
03430                 bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE,
03431                                &log_chn[index].msg_buffer_handle);
03432             if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
03433                sprintf(error, "Cannot open buffer %s", MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME);
03434                cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03435                return 0;
03436             }
03437 
03438             /* place event request */
03439             status = bm_request_event(log_chn[index].msg_buffer_handle,
03440                                       (short) EVENTID_MESSAGE,
03441                                       (short) chn_settings->log_messages,
03442                                       GET_ALL, &log_chn[index].msg_request_id,
03443                                       receive_event);
03444 
03445             if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
03446                sprintf(error, "Cannot place event request");
03447                cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03448                return 0;
03449             }
03450          }
03451 #endif
03452       }
03453    }
03454 
03455    if (tape_flag && tape_message)
03456       cm_msg(MTALK, "tr_prestart", "tape mounting finished");
03457 
03458    /* reopen history channels if event definition has changed */
03459    close_history();
03460    status = open_history();
03461    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03462       sprintf(error, "Error in history system, aborting run start");
03463       cm_msg(MERROR, "tr_prestart", error);
03464       return 0;
03465    }
03466 
03467    /* write transition event into history */
03468    eb.transition = STATE_RUNNING;
03469    eb.run_number = run_number;
03470    hs_write_event(0, &eb, sizeof(eb));
03471 
03472 #ifdef HAVE_MYSQL
03473    /* write to SQL database if requested */
03474    write_sql(TRUE);
03475 #endif
03476 
03477    return CM_SUCCESS;
03478 }
03479 
03480 /*-- poststop ------------------------------------------------------*/
03481 
03482 INT tr_stop(INT run_number, char *error)
03483 /********************************************************************\
03484 
03485    Poststop:
03486 
03487      Wait until buffers are empty, then close logging channels
03488 
03489 \********************************************************************/
03490 {
03491    INT i, size;
03492    BOOL flag, tape_flag = FALSE;
03493    char filename[256];
03494    char str[256];
03495 
03496    if (in_stop_transition)
03497       return CM_SUCCESS;
03498 
03499    in_stop_transition = TRUE;
03500    for (i = 0; i < MAX_CHANNELS; i++) {
03501       if (log_chn[i].handle || log_chn[i].ftp_con) {
03502          /* generate MTALK message */
03503          if (log_chn[i].type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE && tape_message) {
03504             tape_flag = TRUE;
03505             cm_msg(MTALK, "tr_poststop", "closing tape channel #%d, please wait", i);
03506          }
03507 #ifndef FAL_MAIN
03508          /* wait until buffer is empty */
03509          if (log_chn[i].buffer_handle) {
03510 #ifdef DELAYED_STOP
03511             DWORD start_time;
03512 
03513             start_time = ss_millitime();
03514             do {
03515                cm_yield(100);
03516             } while (ss_millitime() - start_time < DELAYED_STOP);
03517 #else
03518             INT n_bytes;
03519             do {
03520                bm_get_buffer_level(log_chn[i].buffer_handle, &n_bytes);
03521                if (n_bytes > 0)
03522                   cm_yield(100);
03523             } while (n_bytes > 0);
03524 #endif
03525          }
03526 #endif                          /* FAL_MAIN */
03527 
03528          /* close logging channel */
03529          log_close(&log_chn[i], run_number);
03530 
03531          /* close statistics record */
03532          db_set_record(hDB, log_chn[i].stats_hkey, &log_chn[i].statistics,
03533                        sizeof(CHN_STATISTICS), 0);
03534          db_close_record(hDB, log_chn[i].stats_hkey);
03535          db_close_record(hDB, log_chn[i].settings_hkey);
03536          log_chn[i].stats_hkey = log_chn[i].settings_hkey = 0;
03537       }
03538    }
03539 
03540    /* close buffers */
03541    for (i = 0; i < MAX_CHANNELS; i++) {
03542 #ifndef FAL_MAIN
03543       if (log_chn[i].buffer_handle) {
03544          INT j;
03545 
03546          bm_close_buffer(log_chn[i].buffer_handle);
03547          for (j = i + 1; j < MAX_CHANNELS; j++)
03548             if (log_chn[j].buffer_handle == log_chn[i].buffer_handle)
03549                log_chn[j].buffer_handle = 0;
03550       }
03551 
03552       if (log_chn[i].msg_request_id)
03553          bm_delete_request(log_chn[i].msg_request_id);
03554 #endif
03555 
03556       /* clear channel info */
03557       memset(&log_chn[i].handle, 0, sizeof(LOG_CHN));
03558    }
03559 
03560    /* ODB dump if requested */
03561    size = sizeof(flag);
03562    flag = 0;
03563    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/ODB Dump", &flag, &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
03564    if (flag) {
03565       strcpy(str, "run%d.odb");
03566       size = sizeof(str);
03567       str[0] = 0;
03568       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/ODB Dump File", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03569       if (str[0] == 0)
03570          strcpy(str, "run%d.odb");
03571 
03572       /* substitue "%d" by current run number */
03573       if (strchr(str, '%'))
03574          sprintf(filename, str, run_number);
03575       else
03576          strcpy(filename, str);
03577 
03578       odb_save(filename);
03579    }
03580 
03581 #ifdef HAVE_MYSQL
03582    /* write to SQL database if requested */
03583    write_sql(FALSE);
03584 #endif
03585 
03586    in_stop_transition = FALSE;
03587 
03588    if (tape_flag & tape_message)
03589       cm_msg(MTALK, "tr_poststop", "all tape channels closed");
03590 
03591    /* write transition event into history */
03592    eb.transition = STATE_STOPPED;
03593    eb.run_number = run_number;
03594    hs_write_event(0, &eb, sizeof(eb));
03595 
03596    return CM_SUCCESS;
03597 }
03598 
03599 /*== common code FAL/MLOGGER end ===================================*/
03600 
03601 /*----- pause/resume -----------------------------------------------*/
03602 
03603 INT tr_pause(INT run_number, char *error)
03604 {
03605    /* write transition event into history */
03606    eb.transition = STATE_PAUSED;
03607    eb.run_number = run_number;
03608    hs_write_event(0, &eb, sizeof(eb));
03609 
03610    return CM_SUCCESS;
03611 }
03612 
03613 INT tr_resume(INT run_number, char *error)
03614 {
03615    /* write transition event into history */
03616    eb.transition = STATE_RUNNING;
03617    eb.run_number = run_number;
03618    hs_write_event(0, &eb, sizeof(eb));
03619 
03620    return CM_SUCCESS;
03621 }
03622 
03623 /*----- receive_event ----------------------------------------------*/
03624 
03625 void receive_event(HNDLE hBuf, HNDLE request_id, EVENT_HEADER * pheader, void *pevent)
03626 {
03627    INT i;
03628 
03629    /* find logging channel for this request id */
03630    for (i = 0; i < MAX_CHANNELS; i++) {
03631       if (log_chn[i].handle == 0 && log_chn[i].ftp_con == NULL)
03632          continue;
03633 
03634       /* write normal events */
03635       if (log_chn[i].request_id == request_id) {
03636          log_write(&log_chn[i], pheader);
03637          break;
03638       }
03639 
03640       /* write messages */
03641       if (log_chn[i].msg_request_id == request_id) {
03642          log_write(&log_chn[i], pheader);
03643          break;
03644       }
03645    }
03646 }
03647 
03648 /*------------------------ main ------------------------------------*/
03649 
03650 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
03651 {
03652    INT status, msg, i, size, run_number, ch = 0, state;
03653    char host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], exp_name[NAME_LENGTH], dir[256];
03654    BOOL debug, daemon, save_mode;
03655    DWORD last_time_kb = 0;
03656    DWORD last_time_stat = 0;
03657    HNDLE hktemp;
03658 
03659 #ifdef HAVE_ROOT
03660    char **rargv;
03661    int rargc;
03662 
03663    /* copy first argument */
03664    rargc = 0;
03665    rargv = (char **) malloc(sizeof(char *) * 2);
03666    rargv[rargc] = (char *) malloc(strlen(argv[rargc]) + 1);
03667    strcpy(rargv[rargc], argv[rargc]);
03668    rargc++;
03669 
03670    /* append argument "-b" for batch mode without graphics */
03671    rargv[rargc] = (char *) malloc(3);
03672    rargv[rargc++] = "-b";
03673 
03674    TApplication theApp("mlogger", &rargc, rargv);
03675 
03676    /* free argument memory */
03677    // Commented out by VT on 27-May-2008
03678    //free(rargv[0]);
03679    //free(rargv[1]);
03680    //free(rargv);
03681 
03682 #endif
03683 
03684    /* get default from environment */
03685    cm_get_environment(host_name, sizeof(host_name), exp_name, sizeof(exp_name));
03686 
03687    debug = daemon = save_mode = FALSE;
03688 
03689    /* parse command line parameters */
03690    for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
03691       if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd')
03692          debug = TRUE;
03693       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'D')
03694          daemon = TRUE;
03695       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 's')
03696          save_mode = TRUE;
03697       else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'v')
03698          verbose = TRUE;
03699       else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
03700          if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
03701             goto usage;
03702          if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
03703             strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
03704          else {
03705           usage:
03706             printf
03707                 ("usage: mlogger [-e Experiment] [-d] [-D] [-s] [-v]\n\n");
03708             return 1;
03709          }
03710       }
03711    }
03712 
03713    if (daemon) {
03714       printf("Becoming a daemon...\n");
03715       ss_daemon_init(FALSE);
03716    }
03717 
03718    status = cm_connect_experiment("", exp_name, "Logger", NULL);
03719    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
03720       return 1;
03721 
03722    /* check if logger already running */
03723    status = cm_exist("Logger", FALSE);
03724    if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
03725       printf("Logger runs already.\n");
03726       cm_disconnect_experiment();
03727       return 1;
03728    }
03729 
03730    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
03731 
03732    /* turn off watchdog if in debug mode */
03733    if (debug)
03734       cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, 0);
03735 
03736    /* turn on save mode */
03737    if (save_mode) {
03738       cm_set_watchdog_params(FALSE, 0);
03739       db_protect_database(hDB);
03740    }
03741 
03742    /* register transition callbacks */
03743    if (cm_register_transition(TR_START, tr_start, 200) != CM_SUCCESS) {
03744       cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "cannot register callbacks");
03745       return 1;
03746    }
03747 
03748    cm_register_transition(TR_STOP, tr_stop, 800);
03749    cm_register_transition(TR_PAUSE, tr_pause, 500);
03750    cm_register_transition(TR_RESUME, tr_resume, 500);
03751 
03752    /* register callback for rewinding tapes */
03753    cm_register_function(RPC_LOG_REWIND, log_callback);
03754 
03755    /* initialize ODB */
03756    logger_init();
03757 
03758    /* open history logging */
03759    if (open_history() != CM_SUCCESS) {
03760       printf("Error in history system, aborting startup.\n");
03761       cm_disconnect_experiment();
03762       return 1;
03763    }
03764 
03765    /* turn off message display, turn on message logging */
03766    cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, 0, NULL);
03767 
03768    /* print startup message */
03769    size = sizeof(dir);
03770    db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Data dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03771    printf("Log     directory is %s\n", dir);
03772    printf("Data    directory is same as Log unless specified in channels/\n");
03773 
03774    /* Alternate History and Elog path */
03775    size = sizeof(dir);
03776    dir[0] = 0;
03777    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/History dir", &hktemp);
03778    if (status == DB_SUCCESS)
03779       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/History dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03780    else
03781       sprintf(dir, "same as Log");
03782    printf("History directory is %s\n", dir);
03783 
03784    size = sizeof(dir);
03785    dir[0] = 0;
03786    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Elog dir", &hktemp);
03787    if (status == DB_SUCCESS)
03788       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Logger/Elog dir", dir, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
03789    else
03790       sprintf(dir, "same as Log");
03791    printf("ELog    directory is %s\n", dir);
03792 
03793    printf("\nMIDAS logger started. Stop with \"!\"\n");
03794 
03795    /* initialize ss_getchar() */
03796    ss_getchar(0);
03797 
03798    do {
03799       msg = cm_yield(1000);
03800 
03801       /* update channel statistics once every second */
03802       if (ss_millitime() - last_time_stat > 1000) {
03803          last_time_stat = ss_millitime();
03804          db_send_changed_records();
03805       }
03806 
03807       /* check for auto restart */
03808       if (auto_restart > 0 && ss_time() > auto_restart) {
03809          /* check if really stopped */
03810          size = sizeof(state);
03811          status = db_get_value(hDB, 0, "Runinfo/State", &state, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
03812          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03813             cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "cannot get Runinfo/State in database");
03814 
03815          if (state == STATE_STOPPED) {
03816             auto_restart = 0;
03817             size = sizeof(run_number);
03818             status =
03819                 db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &run_number, &size, TID_INT,
03820                              TRUE);
03821             assert(status == SUCCESS);
03822 
03823             if (run_number <= 0) {
03824                cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "aborting on attempt to use invalid run number %d",
03825                       run_number);
03826                abort();
03827             }
03828 
03829             cm_msg(MTALK, "main", "starting new run");
03830             status = cm_transition(TR_START, run_number + 1, NULL, 0, SYNC, DEBUG_TRANS);
03831             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
03832                cm_msg(MERROR, "main", "cannot restart run");
03833          }
03834       }
03835 
03836       /* check keyboard once every second */
03837       if (ss_millitime() - last_time_kb > 1000) {
03838          last_time_kb = ss_millitime();
03839 
03840          ch = 0;
03841          while (ss_kbhit()) {
03842             ch = ss_getchar(0);
03843             if (ch == -1)
03844                ch = getchar();
03845 
03846             if ((char) ch == '!')
03847                break;
03848          }
03849       }
03850 
03851    } while (msg != RPC_SHUTDOWN && msg != SS_ABORT && ch != '!');
03852 
03853    /* reset terminal */
03854    ss_getchar(TRUE);
03855 
03856    /* close history logging */
03857    close_history();
03858 
03859    cm_disconnect_experiment();
03860 
03861    return 0;
03862 }
Generated on 6 Jun 2014 for AlcapDAQ:Rootana by  1.6.1
